page.title: 12Housing
page.content: Traditional brick and flint houses are in evidence in the centres of the villages,spaces often infilled with modern houses.Plastered or pebble- dashed pre-1939 houses,some with bay windows,show 20th century ribbon development.The modern estate houses depict the popular architectural trends of their eras - wooden panels and large picture windows giving way to Georgian facades as fashion has changed. An interesting recent development in Naphill has been the use of brick and flint again.One of the included slides shows one built 2 years ago next to another new house designed in the Georgian style (which incorporates a solar heating panel). Many of the original farms have been converted into expensive mews type dwellings and Brands House is now the headquarters of a promotional firm.
